title: Fiction Coach
description: Write better stories. With solid case studies from great books, cult movies, beloved series and kick-ass games!

items.title: How Jk Rowling Made Harry Potter A Mystery
Why Your Fiction Sucks
items.summary:
'It's a fantasy novel. Well, a trilogy, actually!'

Look at that. Obviously, that is the sentence that has the hairs raised on the back of your editor or someone who knows how a story works.

items.title: The Long Walk - How far will you go to take your next breath?
items.summary:
Before The Hunger Games, there was The Long Walk.

And it has a rawness that reflects the drive and hunger of a young Stephen King.

items.title: How to Write A Good Story
items.summary:
You had a great idea and you already started about a dozen times in your head.

Yet you choke in front of your keyboard.

The cursor mocks you.

Blink.

items.title: How an Editor Knows If Your Writing is Good
items.summary:
Developmental editing is a complex and dying craft.

Because if you want to do that, you need to know the process and the mechanics of a story inside and out.

And you can only do that if you know what a story is made of.

items.title: What's Marvel's Overall Theme?
items.summary:
It’s not the best movie franchise that ever was, but it’s the most popular at the moment.

Why is the theme of these stories a theme about complicated relationships with fathers?

items.title: Why Jedis are the perfect antagonists
items.summary:
Even if the Jedi order holds no perverse pleasure in torturing its padwans, emotionally abandoning a kid to his own devices could result in some pretty permanent psychological traumas.

Or Darth Vader.

When it comes to Jedis, George Lucas made one of two things: an error or something brilliant.

items.title: What if the Night King Isn't the Bad Guy?
items.summary:
Many people speculate that the north and the south will eventually rally up to defeat the white walkers.

A great tolkien-esque ending. One that Martin is most likely against of.
